ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Film Thesis Class.

This class is mostly a workshop to facilitate each film thesis, so the insights you get from the class is based on what the other students bring in with some additional contributions from Jon. 

We workshopped my script, idea, and some other items. I feel pretty good going into next semester, when I eventually have to film it.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength and weakness are one and the same. This course is entirely dependent on the engagement and interest of the other students in the classroom. So, when 80% of the room is disinterested in the work you're presenting, it really sucks. 

I think the two ways that it should be improved is that first the expectations of the class should be outlined better as well as should be enforced more, and second there should be a way for others to be incentivized to be more involved.

The class is very freeform which for some works really great, deadlines are pretty flexible.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: You have to for the film production thesis. Take it with people who you know will give you good feedback.
